{"step_by_step_thinking": "The first trimester screening for Down's syndrome involves the measurement of certain markers. According to Document [0], first trimester screening comprised measurement of serum free beta-human chorionic gonadotrophin (β-hCG) and pregnancy-associated protein-A concentrations. This is also supported by Document [10] and Document [14] which mention the use of free beta hCG and PAPP-A for first trimester screening.", "answer_choice": "A"}
